oracle_text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls destroys a noncreature permanent you control, you may destroy target permanent that opponent controls.

Karmic Justice will not trigger off of its ability destroying a permanent since you destroy the permanent and you are not one of your opponents.

Karmic Justice will not trigger if an opponent’s spell or ability causes your permanent to be destroyed indirectly. For example, if the spell caused an ability you control to trigger, and thereby destroy your permanent.

If the ability does trigger, but you have fewer than 200 cards in your library when the ability resolves, the ability will do nothing.
In tournaments, you must be able to shuffle your entire deck within a reasonable amount of time.

This card has received errata such that putting a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield is now optional. This means you no longer need a third-party to verify that you don’t have any creature cards in your hand if you don’t put something onto the battlefield.

The first time one of these triggers resolves, it will be sacrificed for the full effect. Any additional triggers on the stack will do nothing when they resolve because you will be unable to sacrifice it additional times.

name: Thought Devourer
oracle_text: Flying

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you are affected by Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a player’s maximum hand size to four) and then put Thought Devourer onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size would be zero. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be four.

name: Thought Eater

name: Braids, Cabal Minion
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact, creature, or land.
flavor_text: "Home is where you can find a decent graveyard and strangers can disappear without awkward questions."

rulings.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, triggered abilities you control will resolve after triggered abilities your opponents control. If an opponent controls Braids and you control a triggered ability that puts a permanent onto the battlefield, you won’t be able to sacrifice that permanent to satisfy Braids’s ability.

name: Buried Alive
oracle_text: Search your library for up to three creature cards, put them into your graveyard, then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.

rulings.text: You can look in your library and then choose to find any number from zero to three creatures after you look at it.

name: Cabal Inquisitor
oracle_text: Threshold — {1}{B}, {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Cabal Patriarch
oracle_text: {2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{2}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

name: Cabal Shrine
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards X cards, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

name: Caustic Tar
oracle_text: Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target player loses 3 life."
flavor_text:
"Twisted magic, twisted fate,
Force the land to ooze with hate."
—Cabal chant

name: Childhood Horror
oracle_text: Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Childhood Horror gets +2/+2 and can't block.

name: Coffin Purge
oracle_text: Exile target card from a graveyard.
Flashback {B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Crypt Creeper
oracle_text: Sacrifice Crypt Creeper: Exile target card from a graveyard.
flavor_text: To unearth its dinner, it inters itself.

rulings.text: You must be able to target a card in a graveyard to activate Crypt Creeper’s ability. It can’t target itself.

name: Cursed Monstrosity
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever Cursed Monstrosity becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card.
flavor_text:
"Run away It's an . . . um . . . run away"
—Nomad sentry

name: Decaying Soil
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, exile a card from your graveyard.

Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Decaying Soil has "Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, return that card to your hand."

rulings.text: Multiple creatures going to the graveyard at the same time all end up there at once, so either all of them or none of them will cause the trigger to go off, depending on whether or not Threshold was met prior to the creatures going to the graveyard.
The ability in Threshold will trigger only if Threshold was met before the creature goes to the graveyard. So the one that causes Threshold to be met will not trigger the ability.

name: Decompose
oracle_text: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
flavor_text:
"Sheesh How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber

name: Diabolic Tutor
oracle_text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

name: Dirty Wererat
oracle_text: {B}, Discard a card: Regenerate Dirty Wererat.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Dirty Wererat gets +2/+2 and can't block.

name: Dusk Imp
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: It despises humans and squirrels and beasts and dwarves and cephalids . . . well, it despises just about everything.

name: Entomb
oracle_text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.

name: Execute
oracle_text: Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
flavor_text:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Face of Fear
oracle_text: {2}{B}, Discard a card: Face of Fear gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text:
"It's only frightened five people to death. Not my best work."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Famished Ghoul
oracle_text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Famished Ghoul: Exile up to two target cards from a single graveyard.
flavor_text: Memories have distinct tastes. Its favorites are the sickly sweetness of lost love and the bitter smokiness of cruel murder.

name: Filthy Cur
oracle_text: Whenever Filthy Cur is dealt damage, you lose that much life.
flavor_text: Some things even fleas won't bite.

name: Fledgling Imp
oracle_text: {B}, Discard a card: Fledgling Imp gains flying until end of turn.
flavor_text: Imps aren't born knowing how to fly—just how to annoy.

name: Frightcrawler
oracle_text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Frightcrawler gets +2/+2 and can't block.

name: Ghastly Demise
oracle_text: Destroy target nonblack creature if its toughness is less than or equal to the number of cards in your graveyard.
flavor_text:
"Anyone can snap her fingers and yank a soul. I prefer to kill creatively."
—Braids, dementia summoner

rulings.text: This card is not in the graveyard until after you destroy the creature. So it does not count itself when determining the maximum toughness.

name: Gravedigger
oracle_text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.

rulings.text: A “creature card” is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

name: Gravestorm
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent may exile a card from their graveyard. If that player doesn't, you may draw a card.

name: Haunting Echoes
oracle_text: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: While you’re searching the player’s library, you don’t have to find all the cards with the same name as an exiled card if you don’t want to. You can leave any number of them in that player’s library.

name: Hint of Insanity
oracle_text: Target player reveals their hand. That player discards all nonland cards with the same name as another card in their hand.
flavor_text: "Practice makes perfect, but obsession makes better."

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

name: Infected Vermin
oracle_text: {2}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
Threshold — {3}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 3 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Innocent Blood
oracle_text: Each player sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text: Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death.

rulings.text: You can cast Innocent Blood even if some (or all) players control no creatures. Those players are simply unaffected.

name: Last Rites
oracle_text: Discard any number of cards. Target player reveals their hand, then you choose a nonland card from it for each card discarded this way. That player discards those cards.

name: Malevolent Awakening
oracle_text: {1}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: The most popular pit fighters are brought back for encore performances.

name: Mind Burst
oracle_text: Target player discards X cards, where X is one plus the number of cards named Mind Burst in all graveyards.
flavor_text: As haunting as a zombie's curse.

name: Mindslicer
oracle_text: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards their hand.
flavor_text: It is the thing that goes bump in the night.

name: Morbid Hunger
oracle_text: Morbid Hunger deals 3 damage to any target. You gain 3 life.
Flashback {7}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Morgue Theft
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {4}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Mortivore
oracle_text: Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.

name: Nefarious Lich
oracle_text: If damage would be dealt to you, exile that many cards from your graveyard instead. If you can't, you lose the game.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
When Nefarious Lich leaves the battlefield, you lose the game.

rulings.text: If you were going to gain life and you also have a replacement that can turn card drawing into life gain on the battlefield, you can gain life by using the Lich to turn the original life gain into card drawing, and then using the other replacement to turn a card draw into life gain. Nefarious Lich will not replace the life gain with a card draw again because it has already acted on this event.
This card will not prevent you from losing the game due to zero or less life.

name: Overeager Apprentice
oracle_text: Discard a card, Sacrifice Overeager Apprentice: Add {B}{B}{B}.
flavor_text: Slow and steady may not always win the race, but at least it doesn't end up splattered on the walls.

name: Painbringer
oracle_text: {T}, Exile any number of cards from your graveyard: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards exiled this way.

name: Patriarch's Desire
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
Threshold — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/-2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Repentant Vampire
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Repentant Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Repentant Vampire.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Repentant Vampire is white and has "{T}: Destroy target black creature."

rulings.text: If Threshold is met, this card is white. It is not white and black.

name: Rotting Giant
oracle_text: Whenever Rotting Giant attacks or blocks, sacrifice it unless you exile a card from your graveyard.
flavor_text: Wracked with rot, it wrecks and ruins.

name: Sadistic Hypnotist
oracle_text: Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor_text: "Victory in the pits is almost as rewarding as the methods I use to achieve it."

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you’ll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

name: Screams of the Damned
oracle_text: {1}{B}, Exile a card from your graveyard: Screams of the Damned deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor_text: It's important to face your inner demons . . . unless they're the kind of demons that can kill you.

name: Skeletal Scrying
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile X cards from your graveyard.
You draw X cards and you lose X life.

name: Skull Fracture
oracle_text: Target player discards a card.
Flashback {3}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Stalking Bloodsucker
oracle_text: Flying
{1}{B}, Discard a card: Stalking Bloodsucker gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The pits feed both its thirst for combat and its thirst for blood.

name: Tainted Pact
oracle_text: Exile the top card of your library. You may put that card into your hand unless it has the same name as another card exiled this way. Repeat this process until you put a card into your hand or you exile two cards with the same name, whichever comes first.

name: Tombfire
oracle_text: Target player exiles all cards with flashback from their graveyard.
flavor_text: The fondest memories burn brightest. As they're lost forever, the flames grow hotter still.

name: Traveling Plague
oracle_text: Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, put a plague counter on Traveling Plague.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each plague counter on Traveling Plague.
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller returns Traveling Plague from its owner's graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: A counter is placed on every player’s upkeep, not just the controller’s upkeep.
The controller of the dead creature chooses the new creature.

When the enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, this card is placed into the graveyard as is normal for an Aura when it loses what it enchants. The triggered ability returns this card to the battlefield with no counters on it.
In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

name: Whispering Shade
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{B}: Whispering Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: It glides through the shadows until it reaches yours.

name: Zombie Assassin
oracle_text: {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard and Zombie Assassin: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"Zombies don't kill. They recruit."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Zombie Cannibal
oracle_text: Whenever Zombie Cannibal deals combat damage to a player, you may exile target card from that player's graveyard.
flavor_text: Nothing is sacred to the undead—not even their own kind.

name: Zombie Infestation
oracle_text: Discard two cards: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
flavor_text: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.

name: Zombify
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor_text:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder

name: Acceptable Losses
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card at random.
Acceptable Losses deals 5 damage to target creature.

name: Anarchist
oracle_text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.

name: Ashen Firebeast
oracle_text: {1}{R}: Ashen Firebeast deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor_text:
"I'm not sure which impresses me most, its thoroughness or its intensity."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Barbarian Lunatic
oracle_text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Lunatic: It deals 2 damage to target creature.
flavor_text:
"I once saw a single barbarian charge a band of twenty nomads. I've seen some crazy ones, too."
—Nomad sentry

name: Bash to Bits
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Battle Strain
oracle_text: Whenever a creature blocks, Battle Strain deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor_text: The pits swallow the weak as predators swallow prey.

name: Blazing Salvo
oracle_text: Blazing Salvo deals 3 damage to target creature unless that creature's controller has Blazing Salvo deal 5 damage to them.
flavor_text: Barbarians equate courage with the ability to endure pain.

name: Bomb Squad
oracle_text: {T}: Put a fuse counter on target creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a fuse counter on each creature with a fuse counter on it.
Whenever a creature has four or more fuse counters on it, remove all fuse counters from it and destroy it. That creature deals 4 damage to its controller.

rulings.text: If the creature regenerates, the fuse counters are still removed and the four damage is still dealt.

If there are two Bomb Squads on the battlefield when a creature ends up with 4 or more fuse counters, both Bomb Squad abilities will trigger causing 4 damage each even though the first to resolve will destroy the creature.

name: Burning Sands
oracle_text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.
flavor_text:
"Pain teaches lessons no scholar can."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Chainflinger
oracle_text: {1}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 1 damage to any target.
Threshold — {2}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 2 damage to any target. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Chance Encounter
oracle_text: Whenever you win a coin flip, put a luck counter on Chance Encounter.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Chance Encounter has ten or more luck counters on it, you win the game.
flavor_text: The more unlikely the victory, the more memorable the success.

rulings.text: You can only win a coin flip if you are the player flipping the coin. Your opponent losing a flip does not count as you winning one. This is a reversal of previous rulings.

name: Demolish
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact or land.
flavor_text:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song

name: Demoralize
oracle_text: All creatures gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, creatures can't block this turn.

name: Dwarven Grunt
oracle_text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor_text:
Hard as stone and twice as stubborn.
—Dwarven compliment

name: Dwarven Recruiter
oracle_text: When Dwarven Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Dwarf cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.

name: Dwarven Shrine
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Dwarven Shrine deals X damage to that player, where X is twice the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

name: Dwarven Strike Force
oracle_text: Discard a card at random: Dwarven Strike Force gains first strike and haste until end of turn.
flavor_text: Any given foothill may hide dozens of dwarves waiting to spill from their tunnels like fire ants.

name: Earth Rift
oracle_text: Destroy target land.
Flashback {5}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Ember Beast
oracle_text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.
flavor_text:
Spot one ember beast, attack.
Spot a second, best fall back.
—Dwarven saying

rulings.text: Ember Beast can’t attack or block unless another creature is also assigned to attack or block at the same time. Notably, two Ember Beasts can attack or block together.
Once Ember Beast has been declared as an attacker or blocker, it doesn’t matter what happens to the other creature(s).

Other creatures assigned to attack alongside Ember Beast don’t have to attack the same player or planeswalker. Other creatures assigned to block alongside Ember Beast don’t have to block the same creature as Ember Beast.

name: Engulfing Flames
oracle_text: Engulfing Flames deals 1 damage to target creature. It can't be regenerated this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Epicenter
oracle_text: Target player sacrifices a land.
Threshold — Each player sacrifices all lands they control instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
flavor_text: Sometimes destruction is Dominaria's way of rebuilding. Sometimes it's not.

name: Firebolt
oracle_text: Firebolt deals 2 damage to any target.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: Reach out and torch someone.

name: Flame Burst
oracle_text: Flame Burst deals X damage to any target, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Flame Burst in all graveyards.
flavor_text: As hot as a dwarf's rage.

name: Frenetic Ogre
oracle_text: {R}, Discard a card at random: Frenetic Ogre gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The best thing about ogres is that they never try to sneak up on you.

name: Halberdier
oracle_text: First strike
flavor_text: His reputation precedes him—and so does his weapon.

name: Impulsive Maneuvers
oracle_text: Whenever a creature attacks, flip a coin. If you win the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, it deals double that damage instead. If you lose the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: You flip a coin for each creature that attacks, not once per attack.

name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor_text: "I didn't come to play. I came to win."

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

name: Kamahl's Desire
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
Threshold — Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Lava Blister
oracle_text: Destroy target nonbasic land unless its controller has Lava Blister deal 6 damage to them.
flavor_text:
To treat flesh wounds, use earth. To treat earth wounds, use flesh.
—Barbarian saying

name: Liquid Fire
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, choose a number between 0 and 5.
Liquid Fire deals X damage to target creature and 5 minus X damage to that creature's controller, where X is the chosen number.
flavor_text: There's no such thing as a little bit of lava.

rulings.text: You choose the number as you cast the spell. If you choose 0, the creature’s controller will be dealt 5 damage. If you choose 5, that player will not be dealt any damage.

name: Mad Dog
oracle_text: At the beginning of your end step, if Mad Dog didn't attack or come under your control this turn, sacrifice it.
flavor_text: The bones it buries may be yours.

name: Magma Vein
oracle_text: {R}, Sacrifice a land: Magma Vein deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor_text:
Standing near a volcano
—Barbarian expression meaning
"asking for it"

name: Magnivore
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.

name: Mine Layer
oracle_text: {1}{R}, {T}: Put a mine counter on target land.
Whenever a land with a mine counter on it becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Mine Layer leaves the battlefield, remove all mine counters from all lands.

name: Minotaur Explorer
oracle_text: When Minotaur Explorer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
flavor_text: After the invasion devastated the Talruum and Hurloon tribes, the survivors began to search for other minotaurs.

name: Molten Influence
oracle_text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller has Molten Influence deal 4 damage to them.
flavor_text: Lavamancers make simple requests: obey or die.

name: Mudhole
oracle_text: Target player exiles all land cards from their graveyard.
flavor_text: "Doing okay back there, Tarv? Tarv?"

name: Need for Speed
oracle_text: Sacrifice a land: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor_text: His feet buckled the ground, his hands cut the wind to ribbons, and he was gone.

name: Obstinate Familiar
oracle_text: If you would draw a card, you may skip that draw instead.
flavor_text:
"Lizards make excellent familiars. They never know when they've lost."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Pardic Firecat
oracle_text: Haste
If Pardic Firecat is in a graveyard, effects from spells named Flame Burst count it as a card named Flame Burst.
flavor_text:
"I've heard of putting the cat out, but this isn't what I had in mind."
—Nomad sentry

name: Pardic Miner
oracle_text: Sacrifice Pardic Miner: Target player can't play lands this turn.
flavor_text:
"Punch and drag,
Toss the slag,
Sift the soil,
Leave the spoil."

rulings.text: The ability won’t stop lands from being put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability.
The ability won’t stop players from activating the abilities of lands. It only stops land cards from being played.

name: Pardic Swordsmith
oracle_text: {R}, Discard a card at random: Pardic Swordsmith gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: A finely crafted blade will never meet as many blows on the battlefield as it did on the anvil.

name: Price of Glory
oracle_text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, if it's not that player's turn, destroy that land.
flavor_text:
"True strength lies in action. Let the weak react to me."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Reckless Charge
oracle_text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Recoup
oracle_text: Target sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (Mana cost includes color.)
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Rites of Initiation
oracle_text: Discard any number of cards at random. Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.

name: Savage Firecat
oracle_text: Trample
Savage Firecat enters the battlefield with seven +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, remove a +1/+1 counter from Savage Firecat.

name: Scorching Missile
oracle_text: Scorching Missile deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Flashback {9}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Seize the Day
oracle_text: Untap target creature. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: Seize the Day can target a creature that’s already untapped.
If the target creature becomes an illegal target for Seize the Day, the spell doesn’t resolve. There isn’t an additional combat phase or main phase.

If you somehow cast Seize the Day during an opponent’s main phase, that opponent attacks during the resulting combat phase, since it’s still that player’s turn. If you somehow cast it not during a main phase at all, all that happens is you untap the target creature.

name: Shower of Coals
oracle_text: Shower of Coals deals 2 damage to each of up to three targets.
Threshold — Shower of Coals deals 4 damage to each of those permanents and/or players instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Spark Mage
oracle_text: Whenever Spark Mage deals combat damage to a player, you may have Spark Mage deal 1 damage to target creature that player controls.
flavor_text: The Pardic Mountains are known for their spicy cuisine.

name: Steam Vines
oracle_text: Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it and Steam Vines deals 1 damage to that land's controller. That player attaches Steam Vines to a land of their choice.

rulings.text: If this card leaves the battlefield after it triggers but before it resolves, then the trigger will deal damage and destroy the land, but it will not bring this card back to the battlefield.
Moving this card to another land does not target the land.
If there are no other lands to move it to, this card goes to the graveyard as would any Aura that lost the thing it enchants.

name: Thermal Blast
oracle_text: Thermal Blast deals 3 damage to target creature.
Threshold — Thermal Blast deals 5 damage to that creature instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Tremble
oracle_text: Each player sacrifices a land.
flavor_text: Otaria's frequent tremors are the last stages of Dominaria's recovery from the Phyrexian war.

name: Volcanic Spray
oracle_text: Volcanic Spray deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player.
Flashback {1}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Mirari
oracle_text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor_text:
"It offers you what you want, not what you need."
—Braids, dementia summoner

rulings.text: Everything about the original spell is copied, including any decisions made on announcement, such as whether it was kicked or its Buyback cost was paid. Effects on the spell, such as Sleight of Mind or Flashback, are not copied.
If the copied spell requires a target and there are no legal targets, then the copy has the same target (which should be illegal) as the original.
If the spell is countered before the triggered ability resolves, then the ability will make a copy of how the spell looked right before it was countered.
It triggers once per spell, so you can’t get multiple copies of a spell using this card. And since this card is legendary, you can’t control more than one.
The copy is not “cast” so it will not trigger anything that triggers on a spell being cast.
You choose whether or not to pay when the triggered ability resolves.

You are not required to choose new targets. If you do choose, then the targets must be legal. If you don’t change them, the spell is placed on the stack whether or not the targets are legal. The legality of the targets is always checked on resolution of the spell, so the spell may be countered at that time if all of its targets are illegal.
